'''Simple Login Manager''' ('''SLiM''') is a graphical [[X display manager (program type)|display manager]] for the [[X Window System]] that can be run independently of any window manager or desktop environment. SLiM aims to be light, completely configurable, and suitable for machines on which remote login functionalities are not needed.

SLiM was forked from Per Lid√©n's Login.app program, with contributions from Martin Parm for PAM-related classes. SLiM is currently developed by Simone Rota and Johannes Winkelmann, and is currently maintained by Nobuhiro Iwamatsu.

As of March, 2016, SLiM seems to be abandoned. It is not fully compatible with [[systemd]]. <ref>{{cite web|title=SLiM - ArchWiki|url=https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/SLiM|website=ArchWiki|accessdate=29 March 2016}}</ref>

As of September, 2016, [[GhostBSD]] 10.3 replaced [[GNOME Display Manager|GDM]] with SLiM.<ref>{{cite web|title=GhostBSD Enoch|url=http://www.ghostbsd.org/10.3_enoch|date=2016-09-01|accessdate=2016-09-03}}</ref>

== Features ==
SLiM supports the following features:
* [[Portable Network Graphics|PNG]] and [[XFT]] support for alpha transparency and anti-aliased fonts
* External themes support
* Configurable runtime options: X server, login / shutdown / reboot commands
* Single ([[GNOME Display Manager|GDM]]-like) or double ([[X Display Manager (implementation)|XDM]]-like) input control
* Can load predefined user at startup
* Configurable welcome / shutdown messages
* Random theme selection

== Dependencies ==
SLiM has the following dependencies:

* X11
* libpng
* libjpeg
* freetype
